intro: Tragopyrum billardierei, commonly known as the slender burrgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and distinctive, bristly seed heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters. Tragopyrum billardierei is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
